ANML

Roads & Kingdoms

Roads & Kingdoms is a media company that creates inspired editorial on travel, food, culture, arts and politics from unexplored corners of the globe. Excited by the potential, ANML became the design team for R&K from the very beginning.

We established an identity and design system for R&K that would communicate the unapologetic and uncompromising quality of the journalism. We then went to work on R&K’s digital platform—developing an engaging user experience that gracefully housed a variety of multimedia content contributed from around the world.

The blend of digital-savvy design and unique editorial perspective from editors Matt Goulding (author of the Eat This Not That book series) and Nathan Thornburgh (former editor for Time Magazine) was a winning combination. The site has won numerous awards, including America’s Best Travel Journalism Site as named by the Society of American Travel Writers. We continue to be partners in crime, calling R&K when in need of content creation and supporting R&K projects that need a design hand. Photo: Mike Magers

#1 travel journalism site

Content
is king

There is a time when design needs to simply be the delivery mechanism of great content. We kept that in mind, letting the words and pictures take center stage.

Made to
consume

With small fonts, long line lengths and little visual interest, online journalism can be hard to digest. We created a long form article that is easy and enjoyable to read.

Parts Unknown

Transporting Anthony Bourdain fans into the world of Parts Unknown

Bell Helmets

eBay Enterprise and ANML helped reposition Bell’s brand and inspired a new generation of athletes.

Bandai Namco

ANML supported Bandai Namco in bringing their newest fighting game to life.

Yummly

Yummly’s trust in ANML turned a graphics project into a #1 app transformation.

Netapp

ANML enabled NetApp to shatter corporate site stereotypes. And did it in record time.

Autodesk

Insights into the gaming world allowed ANML to revolutionize Autodesk’s software UI.

ServiceNow

ANML helped ServiceNow’s site live up to their promise of “changing how people work.”

Santana Row

Santana Row needed ANML to deliver an online experience worthy of it’s real world one.

Citrix

ANML worked with Citrix to design an immersive blog experience that would shine on every device.

Ernie Ball

ANML created a web experience to celebrate Ernie Ball’s commitment to artistry, innovation, and music culture.
